page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.B.ASH C.FENTON.
page.content: The survey area is composed almost entirely of agricultural land,farmed for arable crops and the two villages of Barkston Ash and Church Fenton. { Barkston Ash}is a nucleated village that has grown around farms.It is surrounded by Barley fields and is predominantly Catholic.Very little employment in the village means most people cmmute to Tadcaster,Leeds or York to work. { Church Fenton}is a linear village strung between the station to the west and the RAF base to the east.Most villagers work in farming or commute to Tad.Leeds or York.Peoples' main complaint is noise from the RAF but do recognise its role as a local employer Villagers living in both places complained about the lack of facilities rural areas experienced.
